oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Immunology of Bovine Pestivirus Infection
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McVey, D. Scott
Reddy, Sudhir K.
Frossard, J. P.
Minocha, Harish
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine viral diarrhea viruses
pestiviruses
bovine viral diarrhea
mucosal disease
fetal disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The bovine pestiviruses (here referred to as bovine viral diarrhea viruses-BVDV) cause three types of disease: bovine viral diarrhea (BVD), mucosal disease (MD) or fetal disease (FD). In each case, the immune system of the host responds in a characteristic fashion (Nettleton and Entrican, 1995).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1996; 116-118
